title: Maid-Rite Pork Tenderloin Sandwiches
directions: Cut a tenderloin into equal serving pieces, then butterfly each piece. Pound the pieces so they are about 4 inches by 10 inches. (This is to get the classic "hang over the bun" look.)
Mix together the eggs, buttermilk, 1/4 cup of the flour, salt pepper, garlic dry mustard and pinch of cayenne. Place the tenderloin pieces in the buttermilk and marinate overnight.

To cook, preheat a deep fat fryer to 360 degrees F. Combine the panko and cornmeal. Remove tenderloin from the marinade and let excess drip off. Press the meat into the panko/cornmeal combination. Fry immediately for 3 minutes or until golden brown. Serve on a bun with mayo, tomato, lettuce and mustard.

Terry's Notes: This is my version. I use Panko bread crumbs because they always give me the best crunch. Most of the time I just dip the pounded tenderloin into the flour, then into some egg with a Tablespoon of dijon mustard, then into the panko. Deep fry and serve on a bun with lots of ball park mustard. But here is the original Pork Tenderloin Sandwich. I believe that Maid-Rite was a restaurant chain.
ingredients: 1 pinch each salt and black pepper
1/4 cup yellow corn meal for breading
